meanings.definition: Of or relating to a corpse.
meanings.sent1: The cadaveric smell in the room made everyone feel uneasy.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the cadaveric remains to determine the cause of death.
meanings.sent3: The cadaveric appearance of the Halloween decorations startled the trick-or-treaters.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a cadaveric stillness that sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the cadaveric essence of death in his haunting painting.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a dead body.
meanings.sent1: The cadaveric expression on his face made it clear he had seen something horrifying.
meanings.sent2: The old, decaying mansion had a cadaveric appearance that gave it an eerie vibe.
meanings.sent3: The cadaveric look of the wilted flowers in the vase made them seem almost comical.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was so thick, it felt almost cadaveric in nature.
meanings.sent5: The cadaveric pallor of her skin indicated she was seriously ill.
